alert.note: Alert for Bureau; Henry (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 4:04PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Bureau and northeastern Henry Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 404 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Annawan, or 12 miles north of Kewanee, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Sheffield around 420 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Buda. This includes Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 28 and 49. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
